summary: This is an email chain from November 4, 2020, discussing the technical progress of a large document production for the case US v. Epstein. It details the vendor's work to bates stamp and export the production in seven parts to a hard drive, with an estimated completion date of November 19, 2020, excluding Florida documents.

events.title: Estimated completion of large document production
events.description: The vendor estimates that the large production (excluding Florida documents) should be completed and copied to a drive by this date, assuming no issues.

events.title: Progress update on document production
events.description: A vendor provides an update on bates stamping and exporting a document production for US v. Epstein, broken into seven parts. Parts 1-3 are finished or in progress.

keyFacts: A large document production for the case US v. Epstein was being processed by a vendor, broken into seven parts for bates stamping and export.
As of November 4, 2020, the vendor had finished parts 1-3 and was starting part 4, with parts being exported to a hard drive.
The estimated completion date for the large production (excluding Florida documents) was November 19, 2020.
The production was searchable under identifiers like 'SDNY_PROD015 - PART 01', indicating it was part of a Southern District of New York (SDNY) production.
Florida documents were mentioned as a separate set the vendor was 'working on right now', indicating multiple document sets in the case.
